intro: Artanthe denudans, commonly known as the naked artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Artanthe denudans is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
